Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 07:30PM littletower wrote: I was on that trial. Turned out I was in the Avastin arm and after two cycles with A/C, ended up with a reduction of my Lvf from 60 to 35. Was taken off immediately, put on meds to increase Lvf function. Was told I had congestive heart failure and that it was permanent. continued with cardio 5-6 times per week and now off my meds and with a fully functioning heart.

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2012 02:35PM littletower wrote: Hey Cindy, I had a lumpectomy initially. I then went straight into 6 months of aggressive chemo and then into another surgery to clear margins before radiation. I opted for what's known as oncoplasty also known as masteoplasty, which allowed them to take lots of tissue from the right and then surgery on the left as well so they would be even. I then had lots of rads on the right breast. Might be an option for you to consider. PM me if you have any questions. Good Luck! Adele

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2016 01:57AM littletower wrote: Hello Ladies; First of all, lots of love to you all. Hate to bother you with potentially stupid crap but I trust your opinions over the docs. As you can see in my signature, lots of aggressive stage 3 cancer. I was/am in the Hopkins vaccine trial and as a result got full scans in August of 2015. Have radiation fibrosis and costochondritis from radiation. Last 4 weeks or so, much sharper and intense pain on lower right bottom rib area directly under the arm area. Onc not really into scanning again and doesn't seem concerned. I don't really want to scan either, but this pain is different. Am I being over anxious? Off to Hopkins next week for annual bloods, but Onc there is away so no second opinion there. They will do a check of tumor markers there. Thanks in advance for your help and gentle hugs to you all. Adele H.
